quotes: Emilia Pires was East Timor's Minister of Finance from April 2007 until 16 February 2015.
Ms. Pires was sworn in as the Minister of Finance of the V Constitutional Government of East Timor on August 8, 2012.

In July 2012, Pires was appointed by the Secretary-General of United Nations, Ban Ki-moon, to the 26-member High-level Panel of Eminent Persons advising the United Nations on the post 2015 global development agenda.
In 1975, as a teenager, Emilia Pires left East Timor (then Portuguese Timor) for Australia as a refugee, with her parents, brothers and sisters.
However, exile lasted for 24 years before Pires was able to return.
Timor-Leste Transparency Portal was launched in early 2011,
Pires held the role until May 2014, when Minister Kaifala Marah of Sierra Leone took over.
Until June 2014, Pires co-chaired the International Dialogue of Peacebuilding and Statebuilding with Denmark and later with Finland,
In July 2012, Pires was appointed by the Secretary-General of United Nations,

Co-authored "How will the Macroeconomy be Managed in an Independent East Timor? An East Timorese view" with East Timor President of the Republic, H,E. Jose Ramos-Horta in 2001, published in the IMF’s Finance and Development Magazine.

Co-authored "National Ownership and International Trusteeship: the Case of Timor-Leste", with Mr. Michael Francino in 2007, published in Boyce James K. and Madalene O’Donnell (eds) in the Peace and the Public Purse: Economic Policies for Postwar Statebuilding.
Retrieved 4 April 2012.
Retrieved 19 September 2012.
Retrieved 19 September 2012.
Ellis, Eric (7 September 2009). "Women to watch in Asia: Emilia Pires" (PDF). Forbes Asia. p. 54. Retrieved 12 August 2023.
Ellis, Eric (7 September 2009). "Women to watch in Asia: Emilia Pires" (PDF). Forbes Asia. p. 54. Retrieved 12 August 2023.
